comp.about.assets.claimInfoHelpText: This image has attribution and history data
comp.about.assets.helpText: Any assets used or added to this content
comp.about.editsActivity.helpText: Categories of actions taken on this content, sorted alphabetically.
comp.about.producedBy.helpText: This name was entered by the producer.
comp.about.signedBy.helpText: Cryptographic signatures assuring that this content record wasn’t tampered with.
comp.asset.badgeInfo.helpText: This image has attribution and history data.
comp.asset.badgeMissing.helpText: This file was edited without content credentials.
comp.asset.badgeError.helpText: Something went wrong. The content credentials for this file are unavailable.
comp.contentCredentials.subtitle: These assets are in chronological order, starting with the latest version. Select one to explore its own content credentials.
comp.contentCredentials.title: Content credentials
comp.contentCredentialsError.missingText: The producer edited this asset without attaching complete content credentials. Other data may be available in the content record.
comp.contentCredentialsError.none: No content credentials for this asset
comp.contentCredentialsError.noneText: This asset doesn’t have a content record attached.
comp.contentCredentialsError.noneForFile: No content credentials for this file
comp.navigation.subtitle: Select a file to inspect its content credentials, or select Compare to start comparing two files.
comp.navigation.title: Content and Ingredients
comp.originalCreation.recorder: This photo was first produced in {application}.
comp.originalCreation.secureCapture: This photo was captured by a secure device.
comp.originalCreation.title: Original creation
comp.viewer.selectFromComputer: Select a JPG or PNG from your computer
page.title: Content Authenticity Initiative
page.sectionOne.bodyA: When an image has content credentials, it has public data that helps you understand what’s been done to it, where it’s been, and who’s responsible.
page.sectionOne.bodyB: Verify gives you an in-depth and tamper-evident look into content credentials like edits and activity, the assets used, identity info, and more.
page.sectionTwo.bodyA: With Verify, you get an overview of an image and its ingredients to view the connection and history of each asset that makes up the latest file.
page.sectionTwo.bodyB: You can also inspect ingredients more directly and compare changes between different files and content credentials.
page.hero.description: Get reliable records of the who, what, when, where, and how of images across the internet.
page.sectionThree.header: Tools and data you can trust
page.sectionThree.bodyA: Verify is a tool created by the Content Authenticity Initiative (CAI) to help make content transparency a norm a standard across the internet, and make content credentials accessible to everyone.
page.sectionThree.bodyB: The CAI is working toward a future where you can find informative, public, and tamper-proof data attached to all content — no matter where it goes — so you can clearly and reliably assess it yourself.
tour.explorePast.content: The most recent version appears first in the content record, followed by previous versions and any component elements, like other images.
tour.explorePast.title: Explore a JPEG’s past
tour.getTamperEvidentData.content: No matter where the content shows up on the internet, the info icon tells you that its record was confirmed.
tour.getTamperEvidentData.title: Get tamper-evident image data
tour.trackChanges.content: Select an image to view its own content record. Or compare it to another entry in the content record in a slider or split-screen view.
tour.trackChanges.title: Track changes over time
